meanings.definition: To fold or crease (something) before the final folding or creasing.
meanings.sent1: She carefully precreased the paper before making the origami swan.
meanings.sent2: The tailor always precreases the fabric to ensure precise folds.
meanings.sent3: The chef precreased the dough for the pie crust, giving it a head start in the oven.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous nature led him to precrease every corner of the letter, symbolizing his attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly, precreasing the edges of the canvas to create sharp lines.

meanings.definition: The act of folding or creasing (something) before the final folding or creasing.
meanings.sent1: The precreasing of the paper made the origami project easier to complete.
meanings.sent2: A clean precreasing of the fabric is essential for a well-tailored garment.
meanings.sent3: The precreasing of the map caused confusion as it unfolded in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The precreasing of the envelope hinted at the surprise inside.
meanings.sent5: The precreasing of the book pages made it easier to flip through quickly.
